#summary Links and resources for HTML5, other shims and fallbacks available, feature support tests, etc.

= Intro =

This page collects information on available shims, feature detection, and links to the working drafts of the specs.


= Specs =
  * [http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/Overview.html HTML5]
  * [http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-workers/current-work/ Web Workers]
  * [http://dev.w3.org/html5/webdatabase/ HTML5 : Web Database]
  * [http://dev.w3.org/html5/websockets/ HTML5 : Web Sockets]
  * [http://dev.w3.org/html5/eventsource/ HTML5 : Server-Sent Events (EventSource)]


= Shims =

== Elements ==

=== All Browsers ===
  * [http://code.google.com/p/fiks-html5/ Fiks.html5]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/webforms2/ WebForms2]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/canvas-text/ Canvas Text]
  * [http://github.com/trieloff/html5flash/ html5flash (video element)] (also see [http://gettingsoftware.posterous.com/html5flash-using-html5-video-and-audio-right blog post])


=== For IE ===
  * IE HTML5 Element "Shiv" by John Resig ([http://ejohn.org/blog/html5-shiv/ original post]), maintained now on [http://code.google.com/p/html5shiv/ Google Code: html5shiv] by Remy Sharp
  * [http://code.google.com/p/explorercanvas Canvas for IE]
